title: Is it me or are hextech chests promoting feeding

replies.body:
If you are going to say something like this, you should probably back it up with your line of thought. 

At this point im pretty confused on what you mean.

people thinking a game is already in the bag, so they start chasing kills and cs, and not just grouping and ending.

I had this happen last season when I accidentally first picked sion without knowing our team would end up full ad (Khazix jg, Yasou mid, Draven adc, Pantheon sup). We managed to win hard early, probably could have ended pre-20min, but we dicked around and chased kills, and at 40min, we literally couldn't scratch their malphite, leona and trundle. We ended up losing a 40-18 or something game.

My team refused to group, they thought since we had broken the base, since we had 2 inhibitors, that the game was already in the bag, and so they started taking jungle camps and chasing kills to improve their chance of getting a hextech chest or for our yasou to get his M7 token. Eventually my fears were realised as the effect of 2 thornmails, 2 randuins, 2 sunfires, a locket, a frozen heart, 2 deadmans and 4 ninja tabis stacked up.

This is what mastery tokens and hextech chests create. People chasing kills. Having this in ranked is unhealthy.
